ai-mn12:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, in the city of Vesālī, at the Muṇḍa.
ai-mn12:2.1_0: Now at that time Sunakkhatta the Licchavi had recently left this teaching and training.
ai-mn12:2.2_0: He was telling a crowd in Vesālī:
ai-mn12:2.3_0: “The ascetic Gotama has no superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones.
ai-mn12:2.4_0: He teaches what he’s worked out by logic, following a line of inquiry, expressing his own perspective.
ai-mn12:2.5_0: But it is for the sake of the teaching that leads someone who practices it to the complete ending of suffering.”
ai-mn12:3.1_0: Then Venerable Sāriputta robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Vesālī for alms.
ai-mn12:3.2_0: He heard what Sunakkhatta was saying.
ai-mn12:3.3_0: “The ascetic Gotama has no superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones.
ai-mn12:3.4_0: He teaches what he’s worked out by logic, following a line of inquiry, expressing his own perspective.
ai-mn12:3.5_0: But it is for the sake of the teaching that leads someone who practices it to the complete ending of suffering.”
ai-mn12:3.6_0: Then he wandered for alms in Vesālī.
ai-mn12:3.6_2: While sitting on one side venerable Sāriputta said this to the Fortunate One:
ai-mn12:3.7_0: “Sir, Paṇḍitakumāra has left this teaching and training.
ai-mn12:3.8_0: He was telling a crowd in Vesālī:
ai-mn12:3.9_0: ‘The ascetic Gotama has no superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones.
ai-mn12:3.10_0: He teaches what he’s worked out by logic, following a line of inquiry, expressing his own perspective.
ai-mn12:3.11_0: Whatever teaching does lead someone who practices it to the goal of the complete ending of suffering.’”
ai-mn12:4.1_0: “No, Sāriputta, there is a silly man,
ai-mn12:4.2_0: His words are spoken out of anger.
ai-mn12:4.3_0: Thinking he criticizes the Realized One, in fact he just praises him.
ai-mn12:4.4_0: For it is praise of the Realized One to say:
ai-mn12:4.5_0: ‘The teaching is for the goal of the complete ending of suffering.’
ai-mn12:5.1_0: But there’s no way Sunakkhatta will infer about me from the teaching:
ai-mn12:5.2_0: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’
ai-mn12:6.1_0: But there’s no way Sunakkhatta will infer about me from the teaching:
ai-mn12:6.2_0: ‘That Blessed One wields the many kinds of psychic power: multiplying himself and becoming one again, controlling many kinds of psychic power:
ai-mn12:6.2_2: Outside the walls, (wholes) go through the sky. It is like the sky.
ai-mn12:6.2_3: They emerge from the earth and water, like the water in the sky.
ai-mn12:6.2_4: As if they consum it into the water, it’s like the earth.
ai-mn12:6.2_5: And the air that lumps the sky.
ai-mn12:6.2_6: And in the case of the moon and sun, so mighty and powerful, they give up all creatures.

ai-mn12:9.1_0: The Realized One possesses ten powers of a Realized One. With these he claims the bull’s place, roars his lion’s roar in the assemblies, and turns the holy wheel.
ai-mn12:10.1_0: Firstly, the Realized One truly understands the possible as possible, and the impossible as impossible.
ai-mn12:10.2_0: Since he truly understands this, this is a power of the Realized One. Relying on this he claims the bull’s place, roars his lion’s roar in the assemblies, and turns the holy wheel.
ai-mn12:11.1_0: Furthermore, the Realized One truly understands the result of deeds undertaken in the past, future, and present in terms of causes and reasons.
ai-mn12:11.2_0: Since he truly understands this, this is a power of the Realized One. ...
ai-mn12:12.1_0: Furthermore, the Realized One truly understands where all paths of practice lead.
ai-mn12:12.2_0: Since he truly understands this, this is a power of the Realized One. ...
ai-mn12:13.1_0: Furthermore, the Realized One truly understands the world with its many and diverse elements.
ai-mn12:13.2_0: Since he truly understands this, this is a power of the Realized One. ...
ai-mn12:14.1_0: Furthermore, the Realized One truly understands the diverse attitudes of sentient beings.
ai-mn12:14.2_0: Since he truly understands this, this is a power of the Realized One. ...
ai-mn12:15.1_0: Furthermore, the Realized One truly understands the faculties of other sentient beings and other individuals after comprehending them with his mind.
ai-mn12:15.2_0: Since he truly understands this, this is a power of the Realized One. ...
ai-mn12:16.1_0: Furthermore, the Realized One truly understands corruption, cleansing, and emergence regarding the absorptions, liberations, immersions, and attainments.
ai-mn12:16.2_0: Since he truly understands this, this is a power of the Realized One. ...
ai-mn12:17.1_0: Furthermore, the Realized One recollects many kinds of past lives. That is:
ai-mn12:17.1_1: one, two, three, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, a hundred, a thousand, a hundred thousand rebirths.
ai-mn12:17.1_2: They remember: ‘There, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food.
ai-mn12:17.1_3: They remember: ‘There, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food. This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended. When I passed away from that place I was reborn somewhere else. There, too, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food. This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended. When I passed away from that place I was reborn here.’ And so they recollect their many kinds of past lives, with features and details.
ai-mn12:17.2_0: Since he truly understands this, this is a power of the Realized One.
ai-mn12:18.1_0: Furthermore, with clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, the Realized One sees sentient beings passing away and being reborn—inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in a good place or a bad place. He understands how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds.
ai-mn12:18.1_1: ‘These dear beings did bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-mn12:18.1_2: They understand how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds.
